security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and reference skill containing PowerShell code examples and best practices. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the detector misinterpreted markdown documentation containing PowerShell examples as executed code. No malicious patterns exist.

content.user_title: Develop PowerShell scripts and GUIs with best practices
content.value_statement: Write production-quality PowerShell scripts, modules, and graphical interfaces. This skill provides templates, Microsoft-recommended patterns, and PowerShell Gallery integration for Windows automation development.
actual_capabilities: Generate PowerShell script templates with proper structure and comment-based help
Create Windows Forms and WPF graphical interfaces with control examples
Search and verify PowerShell Gallery modules using PSResourceGet
Apply Microsoft best practices for naming, parameters, and error handling
Implement pipeline support and splatting patterns in PowerShell code
limitations: GUI development requires Windows platform with .NET Framework
Cannot execute PowerShell code directly - provides templates and guidance only
PowerShell Gallery verification depends on network access

use_cases.title: Automate Windows administration
use_cases.description: Create PowerShell scripts for user management, file operations, and system configuration tasks

use_cases.title: Build deployment tools
use_cases.description: Develop PowerShell modules for CI/CD pipelines, Azure automation, and infrastructure management

use_cases.title: Create Windows interfaces
use_cases.description: Build dialogs and forms for user-friendly PowerShell tools and utilities

prompt_templates.title: New Script
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PowerShell function that [describe functionality]. Use proper Verb-Noun naming, include comment-based help, and support pipeline input.

prompt_templates.title: GUI Dialog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Windows Forms dialog in PowerShell with [list controls]. Include proper event handling for OK and Cancel buttons.

prompt_templates.title: Module Help
prompt_templates.prompt: Search the PowerShell Gallery for modules related to [task]. Verify the module exists and is not deprecated.

prompt_templates.title: Best Practice
prompt_templates.scenario: Refactor this PowerShell script to follow best practices: [paste script]. Apply proper error handling, parameter validation, and WhatIf support.

output_examples.input: Create a PowerShell function to copy log files with progress tracking
output: Generates function template with proper Verb-Noun naming (Copy-LogFile)
Includes comment-based help with SYNOPSIS, PARAMETER, and EXAMPLE sections
Implements Write-Progress for visual feedback during file operations

output_examples.input: Build a simple login dialog with username and password fields
output: Creates Windows Forms form with Label and TextBox controls
Configures password field with PasswordChar for secure input
Adds AcceptButton and CancelButton for keyboard navigation
Shows dialog result handling for OK/Cancel outcomes

output_examples.input: Find modules for working with Excel files in PowerShell
output: Verifies ImportExcel module exists on PowerShell Gallery
Reports latest version, download count, and last updated date
Lists key cmdlets: Export-Excel, Import-Excel, Open-ExcelPackage

best_practices: Use Verb-Noun naming with approved verbs from Get-Verb for discoverable cmdlets
Add [CmdletBinding()] and Parameter attributes for pipeline support and WhatIf/Confirm safety
anti_patterns: Avoid generic nouns like Get-Server - use specific names like Get-SQLServer
Do not skip error handling - use try/catch with specific exception types
Never use Write-Host for output that needs to be captured - use Write-Output instead

faq.question: What PowerShell version does this skill target?
faq.answer: The skill targets PowerShell 5.1 and 7+ with guidance for both Windows PowerShell and PowerShell Core.

faq.question: Can I create WPF interfaces with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides XAML-based WPF patterns for complex interfaces with data binding support.

faq.question: How do I verify a module exists before recommending it?
faq.answer: Use WebFetch to check the PowerShell Gallery page or run Search-Gallery.ps1 for offline verification.

faq.question: Does the skill support module publishing?
faq.answer: Yes, references/powershellget.md covers Publish-PSResource and module manifest requirements.

faq.question: What error handling patterns are recommended?
faq.answer: Use try/catch with specific exceptions, Write-Error for non-terminating errors, and -ErrorAction parameter control.

faq.question: Can I use this skill on Linux or macOS?
faq.answer: Core scripting works on all platforms but GUI features require Windows with .NET Framework.
